title: Skin Revival Project
body:
Currently whe have a lot of ugly or outdated skins in league. For some of them it will probally take years before they get updated since currently these skins only get adjusted when a champion get's a VU update or the cause visual problems ingame.

So I was thinking, what if riot makes an ingame client poll every 1-3 months where you have the option to vote between 3-5 outdated skins for 1-100 RP. Depending on the total votes the skin with the most votes gets an update. The skin get updated depending on the budget that was recieved from all RP  votes. T'is allows them to update their skins that crosses the limitations when the skin was orginally released. T'is can be combined with a chroma set.

Players that did the poll should get a reward like a free chroma when they already owned the skin or a large discount on the skin.

Thoughts?

The value of the skins that go into the reroll don't factor into the chances of what you get. That's why you should only reroll the really cheap ones at 130 / 173 OE (390 / 520 in RP), and disenchant the rest. That way, you're spending minimal essence for the maximum chance at getting a higher value permanent.
There's around 90 skins that are that cheap, 90 skins in the 750 tier, and around 180 in 975 tier. The rest are just bonus.

> The skin get updated depending on the budget that was recieved from all RP votes.

You know it's not like they pay someone else by the money to do it. They'd need to establish special group of artists, designers and a director to take care of it which is a thing of periodical salary rather than one-time payment. There's no reason they should get more money that needed to pay the salary AND If they don't raise enough money, they can't pay them. They'd need to raise X amount of money every session to pay the workers for the session. Also, If you pay via RP, they technically already have the money so they would be able to establish the new team long ago without you telling them "These money go for this thing not that Sona skin".
